title: Autonomous Governance Configuration Schema (v94.1)
description: Defines core trust metrics, risk classification thresholds, and operational governance policies.

risk_classification.description: Minimum Required Confidence (MRC) scores for modification classification (0.0 to 1.0). Enhanced from two to three risk tiers.

critical_architectural_change.description: Highest safety barrier. Required for core system, security, or foundational logic changes.

major_feature_implementation.description: Required for significant component integration or major functionality updates.

minor_utility_mutation.description: Required for utility fixes, dependency updates, or low-risk optimizations.

trust_metric_composition.description: Weighted influence of various sources contributing to the Autonomous Trust Metric (ATM) score.

historic_reliability_score.description: Weight based on the historical success rate and failure rate profile of similar code modifications.

semantic_compatibility_score.description: Weight based on integration testing results and semantic delta analysis.

formal_verification_impact.description: Weight based on static analysis, proof completeness, and compliance checks.

resource_allocation_stability.description: Weight based on anticipated resource usage deviation (CPU/memory/latency) relative to historical baselines.

override_policy.description: Policies governing emergency deployment protocols and required manual intervention floors.

emergency_bypass_threshold.description: The minimum ATM score required to bypass explicit human review/rollback mechanisms during critical operational failure remediation.

manual_review_floor.description: Any proposed modification generating an ATM score below this floor MUST trigger a mandatory human architectural review.
